history.content:
If you can put it off for summer, I would, but that also delays your declaration by a bit. You can always add it and go to the first couple of weeks to see. Knowing 54 does not really help for 70.

----

You should be okay. UGBA10 is (in my opinion) nearly 0 work, and 101B/CompLit/CS70 will be slightly harder than 61A/54/Econ2 but not much. Putting off until next summer delays your declaration by a whole year, and that's under the assumption that you don't find something else to do next summer.
If you can put it off for summer, I would, but that also delays your declaration by a bit. You can always add it and go to the first couple of weeks to see. Knowing 54 does not really help for 70.

children.subject: Being declared allows you higher priority in enrolling for upper-divs.
Is there any advantage to declaring early?
Professors recommend taking the ee16 series before cs70. see Prof. Alon's comments at the end of @4158 He says that Math 54 might not be enough

history.content:
Hi,

I am trying to determine what the workload for CS70 would be like. I am currently taking CS61A, Math 54, Econ-2 and a 1-unit P/NP CS198 and have had basically no free time at all this semester. I have phase 1ed UGBA 10, Econ 101B, a course in Comparative Literature (Arts and L. breadth) and am planning to phase 2 CS70. Oh, and I am also taking 61BL and Stats W21 in the summer.

Keeping the struggles of this semester's workload in mind, is it a good idea for me to take CS70? Would having knowledge of Math 54 beforehand help in any way? Or, should I just wait and take CS70 possibly over the summer next year?
history.subject: CS70 workload
